summary: Build “AIT MIZO”: a web + mobile cloud-based shared media archive for memories and academic question papers with centralized access (all registered users can view all content), strong organization/search, and modern professional UI.
architectural_notes: Centralized shared archive model: all registered users have read access to all content; no private visibility controls
Two primary content domains: Memories (media/files) and Question Papers (images + external links) with foldering/categorization
Use scalable object storage + CDN for delivery; support large uploads and bulk uploads
Provide indexed search and filtering (including subject/year) across relevant content types
Implement backup & recovery strategy for stored content and metadata
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal modern wordmark logo reading “AIT MIZO” with academic + archive vibe, cream background, deep blue/muted purple accents (ait-mizo-logo.dim_1200x400.png)
- App icon symbol (abstract archive/media + academic motif), flat vector style, deep blue/muted purple on cream (ait-mizo-icon.dim_512x512.png)
- Favicon version of the app icon, simplified for small sizes (ait-mizo-favicon.dim_64x64.png)

existing_features.title: Implement authentication using Internet Identity and require login to access the app’s dashboard and all archive features.

Add a unique-username system layered on top of Internet Identity: after first login, require the user to claim a globally unique username; store and display the username as the primary identity in the UI.
Create an Admin panel that allows designated admin users to manage users (list users, view details, grant/revoke admin role, and deactivate/reactivate accounts).
Build the post-login Dashboard layout with two primary sections: (A) Memory Section and (B) Question Paper Section, with navigation optimized for both desktop and mobile.

Implement the Memory Section content model and UI: support uploading photos, videos, and documents; bulk uploads; drag-and-drop uploads; preview before upload; upload progress display; automatic upload date; sorting (newest/oldest); search by filename/metadata; download; and copyable internal share link for each item.

Implement folder management and categorization for Memory items: create folders, rename folders, delete folders (with clear behavior for contained items), move items between folders, and assign categories/labels that can be used for filtering.
Implement the Question Paper Section with two sub-sections: (1) Old Question Paper Images and (2) External Links & Sources, each with its own foldering, search, and categorization controls.
Enforce the centralized shared archive rule: all registered (active) users can view and access all uploaded content across both sections; no private content controls are exposed.
Add storage usage indicator(s): show total archive storage used and optionally per-section usage; update after uploads/deletes and present in a clear, human-readable format.

Add a backup & recovery workflow within platform constraints: provide an admin-only export of archive metadata (and link data) and a documented restore/import pathway suitable for controlled recovery.

Implement a cohesive UI/UX design system matching the requested theme: professional formal + Gen Z modern, clean minimal layout, soft neutral (cream/white) background, deep blue or muted purple accents, smooth animations, card-based grid layout, and fully responsive behavior to function well on web and mobile-sized screens.
Add PWA support so the web app can be installed on mobile devices (home-screen install) and behaves like a mobile app where supported.
Generate required static brand assets (logo and app icons) and render them in the UI (app header/login screen) and PWA manifest/favicon.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create web + mobile app “AIT MIZO” with login-required dashboard
Authentication: unique username login, secure auth, post-login dashboard access
Memory section: upload photos/videos/docs (incl. bulk), search, sort by date, show upload date
Folder management & categorization: create/rename/delete folders, move files between folders
Question Paper section: image uploads with subject/year folders + search/filter + upload dates
External links & sources library: add links with title/description, folders, categorization, redirect
Shared archive rules: all registered users can access all uploaded content; no private accounts
Smart upload/download UX: drag-and-drop, upload progress bar, preview before upload, download option, internal shareable link, storage usage indicator
Infrastructure: scalable cloud storage, CDN delivery, large upload handling, indexed search, backup & recovery
UI/UX theme: clean minimal responsive design (cream/white background, deep blue/muted purple accents, smooth animations, card-based grid)

For Old Question Paper Images: support image uploads (including bulk), drag-and-drop, progress, upload date display, folders structured by subject/year, rename/delete folders, and search & filter by subject and year.

For External Links & Sources: allow adding links with title and description; organize links into folders; rename/delete folders; categorize links by subject/exam type; and provide a redirect/open-link action.
Implement large-upload handling suitable for the Internet Computer environment, including chunked upload support and resilience to transient failures (retry UX where reasonable).

Provide fast retrieval behavior within platform constraints: optimize listing, search, and item retrieval APIs; implement backend indexing for search over filenames/metadata/tags (Memory) and subject/year/exam-type (Question Papers).
